Token.Abstract: NSDictionary+CGMExtensions provides helper methods for interpreting the dictionary returned by the [NSData+CGMParser]
Checks if the E2E-CRC included in the response failed

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the E2E-CRC failed, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the measurement characteristic details for the glucose measurement date and time

ReturnValue.Abstract: The date and time of the glucose measurement as calculated using the measurement time offset and session start time. If the date and time cannot be calculated, nil is returned.

Token.Abstract: Checks the measurement characteristic details for the glucose measurement time offset

ReturnValue.Abstract: The measurement time offset. Units is minutes

Token.Abstract: Checks the measurement characteristic details for the glucose concentration value

ReturnValue.Abstract: The glucose centration value. Units is mg/dl

Token.Abstract: Checks the measurement characteristic details for the glucose trend value

ReturnValue.Abstract: The glucose trend value. Units is (mg/dl)/min

Token.Abstract: Checks the measurement characteristic details for the glucose quality value

ReturnValue.Abstract: The glucose quality value. Units is %

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for the sensor status date and time

ReturnValue.Abstract: The date and time of the sensor status as calculated using the status time offset and session start time. If the date and time cannot be calculated, nil is returned.

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for the sensor status time offset

ReturnValue.Abstract: The sensor status time offset. Units is minutes

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the session has stopped

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the session has stopped, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the device battery is low

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the battery is low, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the sensor type is incorrect

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor type is incorrect, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the device has malfunctioned

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the device has malfunctioned, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the device has had a specific alert

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the device has had a specific alert, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the device has had a general fault

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the device has had a general fault, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that time synchronization is required between the sensor and collector

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if time synchronization is required, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that calibration is not allowed

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if calibration is not allowed, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that calibration is recommended

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if calibration is recommended, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that calibration is required

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if calibration is required, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the sensor temperature is too high to provide accurate glucose meaurements

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor temperature is too high, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the sensor temperature is too low to provide accurate glucose meaurements

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor temperature is too low, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the hyper alert level, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the patient high alert level, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the rate of decrease alert level, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the measurement value has exceeded the rate of increase alert level

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the rate of increase alert level, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the measurement value has exceeded the device lower limit

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the device lower limit, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the status characteristic details for indication that the measurement value has exceeded the device upper limit

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the measurement value has exceeded the device upper limit, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports calibration

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports calibration, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the patient low and high alert levels, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the hypo alert level, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the hyper alert level, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the rate of increase and decrease alert levels

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the rate of increase and decrease alert levels, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the device specific alert

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the device specifc alert, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the detection of sensor malfunction

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the detection of sensor malfunction, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the detection of sensor temperature too low or too high

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the detection of sensor temperature too low or too high, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the detection of glucose measurements exceeding the sensor's lower or upper limits

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the detection of glucose measurements exceeding the sensor's lower or upper limits, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the low battery alert, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the detection of sensor type error

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the detection of sensor type error, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the general device fault, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports the end-to-end CRC

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the end-to-end CRC, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports multiple bonds

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports multiple bonds, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the feature characteristic details for indication that the sensor supports multiple sessions

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports multiple sessions, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the glucose measurement trend feature, otherwise NO

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the sensor supports the glucose measurement quality feature, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a general response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a general response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a communication interval response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a communication interval response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a patient high response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a patient high response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a patient low response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a patient low response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a hypo alert level response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a hypo alert level response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a hyper alert level response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a hyper alert level response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a rate decreased alert level response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a rate decreased alert level response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a rate increased alert level response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a rate increased alert level response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Get the CGMCP response code from a CGMCP general response

ReturnValue.Abstract: The response code, as defined in UHNCGMConstants.h

Token.Abstract: Get the CGMCP request op code from a CGMCP general response

ReturnValue.Abstract: The request op code is the operation just completed by the CGMCP and for which these response details are related to. The values are defined in UHNCGMConstants.h

Token.Abstract: Get the CGMCP response value

ReturnValue.Abstract: A NSNumber with the response value. Values will either be integers or floats, depending on the CGMCP request

Token.Abstract: Checks the CGMCP characteristic details that the response is a calibration response

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the response was a rate increased alert level response, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the calibration date and time

ReturnValue.Abstract: The date and time of the calibration as calculated using the calibration time offset and session start time. If the date and time cannot be calculated, nil is returned.

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the calibration time offset

ReturnValue.Abstract: The calibration time offset. Units is minutes

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the calibration fluid type

ReturnValue.Abstract: The calibration fluid type, as defined in UHNCGMConstants.h

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the calibration sample location

ReturnValue.Abstract: The calibration sample location, as defined in UHNCGMConstants.h

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the next calibration date and time

ReturnValue.Abstract: The date and time of the next calibration as calculated using the next calibration time offset and session start time. If the date and time cannot be calculated, nil is returned.

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the next calibration time offset

ReturnValue.Abstract: The next calibration time offset. Units is minutes

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for the calibration record number

ReturnValue.Abstract: The calibration record number

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for indication that the calibration was successful

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the calibration was successful, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for indication if the calibration data was rejected

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the calibration data was rejected, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for indication if the calibration data was out-of-range

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the calibration data was out-of-range, otherwise NO

Token.Abstract: Checks the calibration details for indication if the calibration process is pending

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the calibration process is pending, otherwise NO
